definition[0]: used when speaking or writing to one or more people to refer to something that belongs to them or is connected with them
example[0]: This is our room, and yours is just across the hall.
example[1]: A lot of people have money problems, but yours are more serious than most people’s.
example[2]: A cash prize of £10,000 or a new car – the choice is yours.
example[3]: Is Maria a friend of yours?
example[4]: That bag of yours weighs a ton.
example[5]: I’ve read that book of yours.
definition[1]: used to end a formal letter that begins ‘Dear Sir’ or ‘Dear Madam’
definition[2]: used to end a less formal letter that begins with the name of the person you are writing to, for example ‘Dear Mr Graves’ or ‘Dear Miss Hope’
